storyInfo: With the aid of the Exiled King, Loughshinny penetrates the barrier in the Dark Woods and reunites with her companions. In the ruins, the wakemen reject Loughshinny's unspoken words, but accept the request to hold a funeral for the departed.

attributes.content: Was that another trick of the shadows? This isn't the right way. I'm going in circles.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I can't see the sky. How long has it been...? How far do I still have to go?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Well, I'm in the Dark Woods, at least. The mist and noise Brigid was talking about didn't keep me out.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Tricky fae, shadows pointing the wrong way, fowlbeasts that trip you with branches... That's all more or less the same as when I was bringing Moran and the others back.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The trees are too tall, and the leaves too thick. They block out the sky, making the life here different from outside.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...This is the right path. I'm at the heart of the Dark Woods now.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The scenery seems different from before. Where did the red and gold of autumn go?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Why does it look like this?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The black mist?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So the woods are rejecting me after all?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Loughshinny grabs her weapon tightly. If Nemos was right, and Dublinn never returned after leaving the city, then they were most likely swallowed by the mist.
But it shows no sign of aggression. It simply lingers.
Does it... reject me?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No, it's closer to indifference... disappointment?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: There is no answer except the rustling of leaves.
Loughshinny shakes her head and cautiously goes around the mist, choosing a path that looks like it has a light at the end. The mist remains indifferent to her passage.
The fae that delight in leading travelers astray are nowhere to be seen.
Another dead end...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No time to waste here. I'm sorry, but I'll have to burn a way through—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You're overthinking it.
Who's there?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Take a guess.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: You... how could it be?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You're that gentleman from the city... I wanted to ask you something, but you—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Indeed, hardly the most amicable of partings. Since then, I've been following and watching you for a while now. Consider it my way of reflecting on myself.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: I'll admit you're not quite what I thought. But this is no time for small talk.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Do not burn the trees. It should be enough to illuminate them with your fire. See for yourself what they really are.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: 'What they really are'...?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The leaves are razor sharp. The brambles are hard, and the branches have a metallic gleam... what is this?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: That's not important. What's important is that your fire can't burn through it.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Now follow me.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Hurry, before the black mist changes its mind!
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: We can talk later, but if that thing is in a bad mood, there won't be anything left to bury when it's done with you.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Isn't that a dead end?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Why do you put so much faith in what you see?
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Just listen and move!
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: This is... the path I took when we came to Na Saoirsí!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So this is where those trails lead?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: If you don't mind me asking, are you and the forest fae—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Don't be ridiculous. I have nothing to do with them.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: The woods, though... Centuries have passed, but it's hardly changed at all, other than the black mist.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Ruins the view, really.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: We'll be out of the Dark Woods soon. Now could you—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Tsk, tsk, this is really...
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: What's happening?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Look behind you.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Reed!
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Reed! We're here!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: The refugees appear on the well-lit edge of the woods.
What happened in the city? It's like the black mist got angry the moment you entered it, cutting it off from the outside. It's been days since anyone went into the Dark Woods.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: A few people were hunting on the outskirts when they heard sounds from within, and saw what looked like fire.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Whenever something similar happened before, the wakemen told us not to approach the woods.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: This time, though, we recognized your fire. We could hardly ignore it.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: You shouldn't have come. It's dangerous here—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Then you shouldn't have either, not on your own. We all learned our lesson about letting you go off alone after waiting for you in the marshes outside Londinium.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: We trust you. So please, trust us back.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You're welcome. Let's go back to camp.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Sir, would you—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Who are you talking to? Is there someone else with you?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: The red dragon turns around, but her uninvited companion has already vanished without a trace, like the dew under the morning sun.
Thank you for providing refuge for these people.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Nemos entrusted them to us. We simply did our part.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: On behalf of the wakemen, I promise that we will not reveal your existence to anyone unaware. And you have seen with your own eyes that your people are safe. Now it is time for you to leave.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: What do you mean? Is she not welcome here?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Neither are your people, Moran.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Whenever two red dragons meet, endless conflict awaits. If you insist on involving yourselves in it, then we can no longer offer you sanctuary.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: How could you?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: This is how we have always been. The wakemen neither start nor end conflicts.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: The disputes of the living are not our concern. We watch over only the souls of the departed.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: If you are truly the noble and compassionate leader Moran imagines you to be, you will not drag these innocents into your battle, red dragon.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: This isn't a battle between two red dragons. I came to seek your help on behalf of the people of Na Saoirsí—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Every battle has its reasons.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: It's not an excuse. Reed wouldn't do that.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Excuse or not, the disputes of the living are none of our concern... A hard-learned lesson whose bitter fruits we continue to taste to this day.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Now leave.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: What if I'm here to ask you to hold a funeral?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A funeral?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: In that case, the wakemen will welcome you. But for that, and only that.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Now tell me the name of the departed, their deeds in life, and... present the remains.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: His name was... Culann. He was a blacksmith.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Culann?!
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: How did he die?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: The purple flames of death took both his life and his will. Not even my flames can help him now.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Then why is it that not a single denizen of Na Saoirsí has come to us to request a funeral since the city became independent?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: So...
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: So it transpires that the first Na Saoirsían to be mourned since the end of the war was not taken by war at all.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: So I weave the straw into a ring like this?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Yes. Then adorn it with these flowers, and the wreath is complete.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I remember when the farmers put a wreath on your head, praying for a good harvest next year.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: ...Mhm.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Feels like old times. I miss that.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Are you not happy here?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I rather enjoy it myself, but the others might find it stifling.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: The life of a wakeman is almost like a self-punishment, after all. What's the word for it again? 'Asceticism'?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: No alcohol, no overeating, no fancy foods—can't even laugh too loud. They wake up before sunrise and sleep after midnight, and everything in between is some ritual or other.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: At least they don't expect the same from us, but there's no avoiding them when we have to help out on the farms and stuff.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: I've practically forgotten how to laugh—hah.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Moran's the only one who goes out of her way to talk to them. She's learning something new every day. Might be how they tie certain knots, might be how to estimate the age of a tree.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Compared to the wakemen in the tales, though...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Your Highness?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Ma'am.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I did not expect to find you here working with them.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Reed has always been like this.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Hm.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Should we excuse ourselves?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: No, I simply came to confirm the facts of the departed's life, for the purpose of the ritual.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Please, tell me. What happened to Culann?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: I will tell you all that I saw, as I saw it.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I hope it makes you feel something.
attributes.name: Loughshinny
